comments.text:
No matter what you do, don't let those distractions distract you, the more 
you think negative the more you don't want to live. There's always a way 
out. The fact that you're still here is proof of that. You know that 
despite everything you've been through, you can push shove struggle and do 
something to make sure you live, because if you die, life won't get any 
better, it will just disappear. You need to stay alive because if you stay 
alive things will always, always get better. Think about something you 
like, that something is good, and so long as you hold onto that something, 
then you have something to live for. Don't give up, if you get through it 
you will look back in a couple of years, glad to be alive and living a 
better life, glad your alive. Everyone goes through some hard times. You 
need to get through yours.
comments.author: Sweaty PvP

top_comment.text:
I've been having a pretty tough time at the moment, I had ME, I have 
anxiety problems and have low self esteem. My gf recently broke up with me 
and my work isn't paying me all my wages. And I know that there are others 
that have it a LOT worse off than me, on the surface I actually have it 
very easy. But I am fed up of constantly trying to impress others and get 
through each day. I want to attack the day and make it my own from now on. 
Thats why I'm planning on going on the Xfactor this year, Ive never sang 
infront of anyone apart from my ex, but I feel like I owe it to myself and 
to prove to me that I can do it if I have the belief. I hope I inspire 
someone else to do something that they've always feared doing and to 
recapture there life, and remember it's not over until we win!﻿

top_comment.text:
I've begun to realize something, watching these motivational videos 
connects with what you are feeling but, in some to most cases, doesn't 
help. You can work for hours after hours to support yourself, go sleepless 
studying for exams to get good grades, or train until your body gives out 
to a point where you want to "succeed as bad as you want to breathe." But, 
in the end, it won't help. No matter how hard you try the guy next to you 
may only work part time, never study, and rarely train/workout but you'll 
never be wealthier and economically stable as him. You'll never get better 
grades or get even close to the grades he gets. And he'll ALWAYS be better 
than you. For example, in my situation and I'm sure others watching the 
video as well, I put in 150% effort into EVERYTHING. I study countless 
hours for exams, I could train 5-6 hours a day but my level will always be 
decreasing at a rate slower than the way the world is moving. I wouldn't 
study for an exam and fail it. If I study my a** off, I would get a C. For 
others, they DON'T study and they'd get a C maybe B- and they study and 
would easily get an A. In todays world with the competition, I am not 
cutting it. Hard work is not cutting it. Nothing is helping me achieve my 
many goals. And life is rough, I understand that and I'm sure much of you 
have it worse but I'm sick and tired of this constant effort for 
nothingness. I'm sick and tired of utilizing my many resources and putting 
in the effort but not living my life on MY terms. However, one thing I am 
practicing is getting back up and keeping a positive attitude, which I am 
adept at. However, these videos keep stating to "get back up because I am 
eventually bound to achieve." This has been going on for 2 years and is 
getting worse, and I'm afraid I'm not going to have enough chances to get 
back up anymore. Sooner or later, college applications will come and I'll 
be in the same or lower place and working even harder. Every day I have a 
positive attitude because I am embarrassed with my performance and create 
this false reality to my peers that makes me believe I am successful, when 
I am not. The point is I will keep trying but, one of these days, I'll 
already be too far in the abyss from failures to ever get back up...﻿
top_comment.author: Baller_27 Baller

comments.text: Appreciate the feedback
comments.author: Baller_27 Baller

comments.text:
+fuckyeah009 Fucking respect, man. I've been going through some pretty hard 
times the past year and a half, as well - Three Decembers ago, I was taking 
my GSCEs. I failed. Didn't take life seriously. I've always wanted to join 
the British Army, so, I decided to turn my life around; my A Levels (step 
above GSCEs) was a two-year course (I was in Ireland, at the time, after 
moving there from the UK a couple of years beforehand). I was set on 
studying like mad and acing everything. The first year went past and I was 
still a pot-smoking waster that I was a year back. Second year came, and I 
was still the same. But, in the final few months before the last exams, I 
grabbed all of my textbooks, got my head down and studied from 9am to 6pm 
everyday. I didn't leave the house until the exams came along. I came out 
after the two weeks with some of the best results in my Year. And I got the 
qualifications needed for my dream of the BA's Intelligence Corps. I was 
piss-poor, and had been my whole life (I still am), but I managed to work 
every Saturday so that I could move back to the UK to join. I scraped 
enough together and moved back last Sep. to live with my nan. She helped me 
get a 2nd-hand suit for my interview (that I had been running through in my 
head for the past 2 years). I passed it. Had my pre-selection last month; 
smashed that, too. Final two-day Selection is next month now, and then the 
five-day INT Corps selection after that. It's 4am here and I've just gone 
for a three-mile run (I'm gonna increase it). I've come so far in three 
years, and like you basically said - it's all down to hard work and 
dedication, and the belief that you can do it. Nearly my whole family is 
against my choice; cousins, sisters, parents, uncles, even my 
brother-in-law. Even my teachers in school were. They're all in that hippie 
mindset, or, I "won't be able to do it".

To anyone that read all of this, you can turn your life around and make 
yourself who you want to be. All you have to do is do what is needed to be 
done to get to where you want to be.

If you don't do it; you won't get there.
comments.author: Liquicitizen Harun

top_comment.text:
Life is tough as shit! It either makes you weaker or it makes you very 
strong. It either wakes you up for the better and the realisation it takes 
a fucking gladiator to do something big in life, or puts your dreams and 
aspirations to sleep forever... Sadly, most people fall to the grave with 
their dreams by age 25 years young. Whatever field you choose, whatever 
your dream is - always remember, you're whole system has to be maintained - 
you physical health, your mental health and emotional health. Meditation 
cleanses your negative thoughts and moods for emotional clarity and brings 
you into focus and helps aid positivity in general. Clean foods and water 
keep you strong, energetic and optimistic. Working out builds you physical 
and mental strength (as long as your pushin' limits) learning new skills 
inspires you to keep pushing and fighting the hardest fight of all - LIFE!

Good luck people! And remember, there's no such thing as a problem, they're 
just new challenges in your life. Man up and burn these fuckers to the 
ground ;)﻿

comments.text:
How do I know that God is the reason we have a Mind and a Heart.... Well 
for the pure reason that chaos and order can not arise out of nothing, also 
an other reason is morality, God is the best or only explanation for this 
moral experience. Plus Morality is objective and absolute, I could throw 
you all the evidence in the world for God's existence but, If there is no 
God than we are just supposed evolved apes in the continuous process of 
evolution for better and brighter and that means there is probably nothing 
bad in having flaws or acting like animals because we are still supposedly 
evolving , still suppoedly perfectioning. For the atheist the first 
possibility is to exaggerate for his self loving taste. Ultimately the 
almost atheist makes a choice. He will reject God not because of lack of 
evidence but because of pride and ego, cowerdly picking the easier way out. 
. the atheist would rather believe a dead philosophy than to believe the 
Truth.
comments.author: Liquid Selection | Fresh, Liquid Drum & Bass

comments.text:
+Liquid Selection | Fresh, Liquid Drum & Bass
There's a good question to start us off with. How do you know for a fact 
that God is the reason we have a mind and heart? We'll start off like that. 
Next, it's always hilarious when people like you think you know my belief 
systems better than I do. Well, I do not believe that intelligence comes 
from rocks and non living materials. We are all technically non living 
material that works because of chemical changes and electricity. It's hard 
for me to say that that's what I think given that defining intelligence is 
difficult. 
I'm not surprised that you apply a circular argument for the origin of 
intelligence. This is you. "Intelligence came from intelligence". Do you 
not see how ridiculous and circular that sounds? I'm guessing that you will 
say that God created it. 
1. How do you know God created it? 
2. How did God come to be, and how do you know that that is the answer? 
You cannot criticize an argument that actually has logic and reason to it, 
when you're making an argument that is dependent on logical fallacies to 
support itself.
comments.author: David. Vox Populi

comments.text: Ip Man
comments.author: Armando C

captions.text: Where have you been?
Why are you here?
And Where are you going?
You look at your life...you look at what you produce...
…is it giving you what you want? Are you living your own purpose? Are you living your dream? Are you acting on your ideas?
Are you doing all you can do? Have you gotten comfortable?
Are you procrastinating? Are you invading your own greatness? Are you surrounding yourself with people that can en-nourish you?
Are you challenging yourself? Are you experimenting? Are you learning something different?
Is your life an adventure or is it boring?
Why are you here? What brought you here? Investing the time, the money?
What brought you here?
What decisions are you making, right now, as you look into your future?
Where are you going with your life?
I don't care how hard you fail. I don't care how many times you fail the test. I don't care if nobody believes in you.
It only takes you to believe in yourself to get this thing done.
As long as you believe in you...you got the right mind set...you got the right attitude, you can have whatever you like.

But if you fall...I need you to fall forward. 
I need you to fail forward.
Are there going to be some moments where you want to give up? Yes.
Will there be some moments when its going to seem like it's impossible
the pain that you're experiencing, the disappointment that you are experiencing that you're going to say...It's not worth it? Yes, that's going to be…
…right there for you. Its going to be in your face. Telling you to go back?
But don't let the distractions distract you. You gotta keep moving...don't stop!
Separate what you do from who you are.
That's what the guilt trap is all about.
All of us have made some mistakes in life. All of us have done some things…
…that if we had them to do over again we wouldn't do it again.
There are a lot of things that if I had it to do over again...if I knew then what I know now...
I would have done it differently. Well, it didn't happen that way.
A lot of us because of our limited vision of ourselves...A lot of us we begin to focus our problems
and enable them to overwhelm us...we begin to think that we have no options. We begin to believe that there is no way out.
We begin to believe that there is no way out.
You can always better your best. You can always go beyond anything that you have ever done.
And I`m saying that… The fact that you are still here...that you are still breathing...You have some more work
and you owe it to yourself, that when you get up in the morning that you can look yourself in the face and say....'Hey, I am living my life on my terms.
There are sometime in life where you fall down and feel you don't have the strength to get back up.
Pretend that everything is OK when its not. And you go home and lay in your bed
when no one is looking at you and you don't have to impress anybody.
And fear comes in. You know the fear that you have as soon as you walk into the doors of your house, maybe its a broken home.
Maybe you have doubt in your life.
Maybe you don't know for sure what's going to be happening in the future...and it scares you.
Maybe you are worried about what people think about you, what people say about you...

And that fear paralyzes you? And I just want to ask you...

Do you think you have hope?
Right now you`re at the worst place in you`re life that you`ve ever been…
I believe that this is your beginning, but this doesn't have to be your end.
That just because you are currently here...this is your present circumstances...
that life don't have to end for you right now.
What is it that will give you the drive? What is it that will ignite the courage in you to get up and come back again and again and again?
Your WHY! Your WHY is going to push you when you can't push yourself.
When you want to quit and give up. Your WHY is going to give you that edge you need. That advantage you need...that lift that you need to get to the next level. YOUR WHY.
Yes we are tired. Yes, we're hungry. Yes, the mind is saying give up. Yes, its saying quit.
But we cannot quit...Because we realize we have not reached the goal yet.
This is not what I said I was going to do. This is not what I talked about. This is not the goal. This is not what I dreamed about.
This is not the goal. This is not what I dreamed about. This is not what it looks like.
I will try 100 times to get up and if I fail 100 times
if I fail and I give up...
do you think that I am ever going to get up.
NO!
So I need you to believe.
But if I fail...I try again...and again...and again...for as long as I try there is always that chance of getting up.
You can decide that you are going to stand up to life.
It's not the end until you have given up.
There is still hope.
You are going to work through this. You are going to get up. You're going to get dressed. You're going to get out and you're going to do
what you've been called to do. You are going to be. You are going to have. You are going to prove to everybody that tried to break you...
everybody that tried to stop you...everybody that tried to kill your dream...
You are going to prove all of them wrong. I use the pain to push me to greatness.
And I am telling you right now...Don't give up! I am telling you right now...Don't give in! Get through it!
There is still time...as long as there is breath in your nostrils...as long as you can wake up in the morning..
...It matters how you will finish. Then you will find that strength to get back up.
"If you are still in the game...which means that if you're in the game...
and there is still time in the game....there is still time left in the game...
then you can still win the game.
You can't afford not be you. You cannot afford just to go to work just so you can get a check.
You cannot afford to not see what your greatest is. You cannot afford to not put your foot all of the way down and see what you can get out of life.
You can get knocked down, but you will not be knocked out.
I am going to empower me and all of these things that are happening to me right now...
They're just temporary inconveniences. They're not stronger than I am.
"You can't afford not to be you.
You're going through some hard times...? It has not come to stay...it has come to pass.
It takes guts to pick yourself up. It takes guts...You gotta dig down deep and gut it out and keep on going again and again and again.
Until you make it happen, because you know that it's possible.
Maybe right now life's got you up against the wall. You can't give up. You can't give in...
because if it was easy...everybody would do it. Because if life's got you backed up...start fighting back.
If life's got you knocked you down try to land on your back...because if you can look up...you can get up.
It's necessary that you take responsibility. That you make it happen...
that you don't give up. That you keep on keeping on. That you don't decide that I can't make it because I can't see the light at the end of the tunnel.
We have so much energy that can take us so far.
It's necessary that you look up and put your money and your energy that can take you to the next level.
Just go out there.
It's possible that you can get what you want. Its necessary if you want it you gotta go into action.
You gotta be willing to experiment. You gotta be willing to fail and to succeed.
Here's your dream manifested. No, it`s hard. Yes, its hard.
Its difficult. That's right!
And it's worth it!
It's necessary that you have a plan of action. That your resilient. That you stick to it.
That you have the vision and never give up.
That you become creative and relentless and keep on coming back again and again and again.
And that it's YOU that you gotta take personal responsibility to make it happen.
And that it's hard. Easy is not an option.
And when life knocks you down. Jump back up and say...'It's not over until I win!
Subtitled by Sasha Zivers
